dt: {bc}the seed coverings and other debris separated from the seed in threshing grain

dt.t: a few kernels of wisdom amid much discursive {wi}chaff{/wi}

dt: {bc}the scales borne on the receptacle among the florets in the heads of many composite plants
{bc}material (such as strips of foil or clusters of fine wires) ejected into the air for reflecting radar waves (as for confusing an enemy's radar detection)

et: Middle English {it}chaf{/it}, from Old English {it}ceaf{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}cheva{/it} husk
shortdef: the seed coverings and other debris separated from the seed in threshing grain
the scales borne on the receptacle among the florets in the heads of many composite plants
